page.title: 01THE AREA AROUND FAIR OAK
page.content: Fair Oak was once a small village but now it has grown to a semi-urban sprawl with a population of more than 10,000. It is now almost joined to neighbouring Bishopstoke (which lies partly within our area)with new housing developments eating away at the open farm and woodland between. Three miles to the west is Eastleigh once an important railway town, where many of the inhabitants of Fair Oak work. Eight miles to the north is Winchester and Southampton is the same distance to the south. Much of the open land is farmland with some emphasis on dairy farming but with also a great deal of fruit and vegetable growing. Although not the principal strawberry growing area- many farmers have gone over to "pick your own"marketing. There is little or no industry.
